channel.title: CVE Feed for ProfilePress -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ProfilePress -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-34623|2024-08-04T00:19:47.737Z -- profilepress -- profilepress
item.description: A vulnerability in the image uploader component found in the ~/src/Classes/ImageUploader.php file of the ProfilePress WordPress plugin made it possible for users to upload arbitrary files during user registration or during profile updates. This issue affects versions 3.0.0 - 3.1.3. .

item.title: CVE-2021-34621|2024-08-04T00:19:47.452Z -- profilepress -- profilepress
item.description: A vulnerability in the user registration component found in the ~/src/Classes/RegistrationAuth.php file of the ProfilePress WordPress plugin made it possible for users to register on sites as an administrator. This issue affects versions 3.0.0 - 3.1.3. .

item.title: CVE-2021-34624|2024-08-04T00:19:47.669Z -- profilepress -- profilepress
item.description: A vulnerability in the file uploader component found in the ~/src/Classes/FileUploader.php file of the ProfilePress WordPress plugin made it possible for users to upload arbitrary files during user registration or during profile updates. This issue affects versions 3.0.0 - 3.1.3. .

item.title: CVE-2021-34622|2024-08-04T00:19:47.472Z -- profilepress -- profilepress
item.description: A vulnerability in the user profile update component found in the ~/src/Classes/EditUserProfile.php file of the ProfilePress WordPress plugin made it possible for users to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator while editing their profile. This issue affects versions 3.0.0 - 3.1.3. .
